title: How Many Times Has Elon Musk Been Married? The Full Story From Me
meta_description: I've been married 3 times to 2 women. Here's my complete marriage history - from Justine Wilson to marrying Talulah Riley twice. The real story in my words.
answer: I have been married three times to two different women. My first marriage was to Justine Wilson from 2000 to 2008. Then I married Talulah Riley twice - first from 2010 to 2012, and again from 2013 to 2016. So technically, three marriages, but only two wives.

h2_sections.heading: The Direct Answer: Three Marriages, Two Women
h2_sections.content: Let me give you the straightforward answer right away. I have been legally married three times. However, these marriages were to only two women. My first wife was Justine Wilson, a Canadian author I met during my undergraduate years at Queen's University in Ontario. We were married in 2000 and divorced in 2008. My second wife was Talulah Riley, a British actress. Here is where it gets interesting - I married Talulah twice. Our first marriage lasted from 2010 to 2012, and after reconciling, we married again in 2013 before finally divorcing in 2016. So when people ask how many times I have been married, the accurate answer is three times, but I have only had two wives in my lifetime.

h2_sections.heading: My First Marriage: Justine Wilson (2000-2008)
h2_sections.content:
Justine Musk, born Justine Wilson, was my college sweetheart. I met her at Queen's University in Canada when I was just starting my academic journey. I was immediately drawn to her intelligence and passion for writing. We dated throughout my university years and got married in January 2000, just as I was beginning to see success with my first company, Zip2.

Our marriage lasted eight years and produced five sons together. We had twins Griffin and Vivian in 2004, followed by triplets Kai, Saxon, and Damian in 2006. Tragically, we also lost our first child, Nevada Alexander, to sudden infant death syndrome in 2002 when he was just ten weeks old. That loss profoundly affected both of us.

The divorce in 2008 was difficult, as all divorces are. Justine has been open about her experience, writing about the challenges of being married to someone building multiple companies simultaneously. I was consumed by work - first with PayPal, then with SpaceX and Tesla. In retrospect, I understand that my intense focus on work created significant strain on our relationship. The divorce proceedings were public and at times contentious, but we have worked to maintain a cooperative relationship for the sake of our children.

h2_sections.heading: Talulah Riley: The Woman I Married Twice (2010-2012, 2013-2016)
h2_sections.content:
I met Talulah Riley at a London nightclub in 2008, shortly after my separation from Justine. Talulah is a talented British actress known for her roles in Pride and Prejudice and later Westworld. We connected immediately, and our relationship moved quickly.

We married in 2010 in a ceremony at the Dornoch Cathedral in Scotland. However, by 2012, we had filed for divorce. The demands of my work and the challenges of maintaining a relationship across continents while I built Tesla and SpaceX proved difficult.

But here is the thing about Talulah - we genuinely cared for each other. After our first divorce was finalized, we found ourselves drawn back together. We remarried in 2013, hoping that the second time would work better. We both tried to make adjustments, but ultimately, the same challenges persisted. In 2016, I filed for divorce again, though we remained on good terms.

Talulah and I parted as friends. She has spoken kindly about our time together, and I have great respect for her. Sometimes two people can care deeply for each other but still not be compatible for marriage. That was our situation.

h2_sections.heading: Key Details About My Marriage History
h2_sections.content:
There are several important facts about my marriages that often get overlooked or confused in media reports. First, while I have been married three times, I have never had more than one wife at any given time. Each marriage ended before the next began.

Second, all five of my children from marriage came from my first marriage to Justine. My other children - X AE A-XII and Exa Dark Siderael with Grimes, and the children I have with Shivon Zilis - were born outside of marriage.

Third, I have not been married since 2016. While I have had significant relationships since then, including my time with Grimes, none of these have resulted in marriage. Some people assume that because I have had children with other partners, I must have married them, but that is not the case.

Fourth, my divorce settlements, particularly with Justine, involved significant financial arrangements. The details were heavily covered in the media at the time, though I prefer not to dwell on the specifics out of respect for everyone involved.

h2_sections.heading: My Perspective on Marriage and Relationships
h2_sections.content:
I will be honest with you - maintaining relationships while running multiple companies is extraordinarily difficult. SpaceX is trying to make humanity multi-planetary. Tesla is accelerating the transition to sustainable energy. These are not small undertakings, and they demand enormous amounts of time and mental energy.

Looking back at my marriages, I recognize that I was not always the partner I should have been. When you are working 100-plus hours per week, when you are sleeping on the factory floor during production hell, when the fate of thousands of employees and the success of critical missions hangs in the balance - it is hard to also be fully present at home.

This is not an excuse, merely an explanation. Both Justine and Talulah deserved partners who could give them more than I was able to at the time. I have learned from these experiences, though I am still figuring out how to balance world-changing work with personal relationships.

I believe in love and partnership. Marriage is a beautiful institution when it works. For me, it has been challenging, but I do not regret the relationships themselves - only that I could not make them last.

h2_sections.heading: Common Misconceptions About My Marriages
h2_sections.content:
There are several misconceptions I want to address. First, some people think I have been married more than three times. This is false. Three marriages is the complete count.

Second, some assume Grimes was my wife. While we had a significant long-term relationship and two children together, we were never legally married.

Third, there are rumors about other secret marriages or relationships. Let me be clear - there are no secret marriages. My marriage record is public and consists of exactly three marriages to two women.

Fourth, some people claim my divorces were especially acrimonious or unusual. In reality, while divorce is never easy, my separations from both Justine and Talulah ultimately reached reasonable conclusions. We all moved on with our lives.

Fifth, there is sometimes confusion about which children came from which relationship. For the record: Griffin, Vivian, Kai, Saxon, and Damian are from my marriage to Justine. X and Exa are from my relationship with Grimes. My additional children are from my relationship with Shivon Zilis. Talulah and I did not have children together.

h2_sections.heading: Looking Forward: My Views on Future Relationships
h2_sections.content:
People often ask if I will marry again. The honest answer is that I do not know. I am focused on my work and on being a good father to my children. If the right relationship comes along, I would not rule out marriage, but it is not something I am actively pursuing.

What I have learned from my three marriages is that compatibility requires more than love. It requires aligned life goals, similar expectations about time and attention, and mutual understanding of priorities. For someone with my work commitments, finding that alignment is particularly challenging.

I remain optimistic about the future, as I always am. Whether that future includes another marriage remains to be seen. For now, I am grateful for the lessons my marriages taught me and for the wonderful children who came from my first marriage.

h2_sections.heading: Final Thoughts on My Marriage Journey
h2_sections.content:
So there you have it - the complete answer to how many times I have been married. Three times, to two remarkable women, over a span of sixteen years. Each marriage taught me something about myself, about relationships, and about the challenges of balancing extraordinary ambitions with personal life.

I do not view my divorces as failures in the traditional sense. They were endings, yes, but they were also chapters in a larger story. Both Justine and Talulah are intelligent, talented women who deserved happiness, and I hope they have found it.

As for me, I continue forward. Building rockets, making electric cars, developing AI, and trying to secure a future for humanity. These remain my primary focuses. But I carry the lessons from my marriages with me, and I am grateful for the experiences, even the difficult ones. That is life - complicated, challenging, and ultimately worth living fully.
